revised_title: Effects of Increased Arterial Pressure on the Mammalian Heart
tldr: This study investigates the effects of increased arterial pressure on the mammalian heart, specifically examining the role of the medullary cardio-inhibitory mechanism and the vagus nerves. The results show that a sudden rise in blood pressure leads to changes in the heart's rhythm and contraction force, which can impact the heart's ability to pump blood effectively.
